polar_to_rect.m

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 %%
00002 %! @file
00003 % Map polar coordinates to rectangular coordinates
00004 %
00005 
00006 %%
00007 %! 
00008 % @param theta angles of Radon transform. Values of theta in each columns of Fourier_Radon
00009 % @param omega_s values of omega_s in each rows of Fourier_Radon
00010 % @param Fourier_Radon Matrix of Fourier transformed Radon image
00011 % @param N_image minimium size of the image
00012 % @param interp_m method of interpolation, can be 'nearest','linear' or 'cubic'
00013 % @param DEBUG Debug mode. If DEBUG=1, surface of Fourier_Radon in polar coordinates and in rectangular coordinates will be saved.
00014 % @retval Fourier_2D Matrix of the mapped Fourier space. By central slice theorem, this is equivalent to the 2D Fourier transform of the original image.
00015 % @retval axis_omega_xy values of omega_x (or omega_y) in the columns (or rows) of Fourier_2D.
00016 function [Fourier_2D axis_omega_xy] = polar_to_rect(theta,omega_s,Fourier_Radon,N_image,interp_m,DEBUG)
00017 %% Check correctness of input data
00018 [size_omega_s size_theta] = size(Fourier_Radon);
00019 length_theta = length(theta);
00020 length_omega_s = length(omega_s);
00021 
00022 if(length_theta ~= size_theta)
00023  error('size of theta does not match with the size of Fourier_Radon!')
00024 elseif(length_omega_s ~= size_omega_s)
00025  error('size of omega_s does not match with the size of Fourier_Radon!')
00026 end
00027 
00028 %% Preparations
00029 % entend the range of Fourier Radon space so that value at theta=0 and theta =180 can be interpolated
00030 % Disabled so that the effect of scan range could be investigated
00031 %Extended_Fourier_Radon = horzcat( Fourier_Radon, Fourier_Radon(:,size_theta) );
00032 %theta = [theta 180];
00033 
00034 % Label each elements in the matrix Fourier_Radon with the corresponding theta and omega_s:
00035 [THETA OMEGA_S] = meshgrid(theta,omega_s);
00036 
00037 %Define the desired scale of the rectangular coordinates
00038 x = linspace(-N_image/2,N_image/2,N_image);
00039 y = x;
00040 dx=1;
00041 d_omega = 2*pi/N_image;
00042 omega_x = x * (d_omega / dx);
00043 omega_y=omega_x;
00044 
00045 % Label each (omega_x, omega_y) to (omega_s, theta)
00046 [OMEGA_X OMEGA_Y] = meshgrid(omega_x, omega_y);
00047 [THETA_I OMEGA_SI] = cart2pol(OMEGA_X,OMEGA_Y);
00048 
00049 % map from {theta,omega_s : [-pi,pi],[0,inf]} to {theta,omega_s : [0, 180],[-inf,inf]}
00050 OMEGA_SI = OMEGA_SI .* sign(THETA_I);
00051 THETA_I = mod( THETA_I * (180/pi), 180);
00052 
00053 %% Apply interpolation
00054 % disable extrapolation: everything outside the defined space is set to zero.
00055 Fourier_2D = interp2(THETA,OMEGA_S,Fourier_Radon,...
00056         THETA_I,OMEGA_SI,interp_m,0);
00057 axis_omega_xy = omega_x;
00058 
00059 %% DEBUG: Print surface of Fourier_Radon before and after interpolation
00060 if(DEBUG)
00061 [WX WY] = pol2cart(THETA,OMEGA_S);
00062 figure
00063 surf(WX,WY,abs(Fourier_Radon),...
00064         'edgecolor','none')
00065 colormap(jet),colorbar
00066 title('Surface of Fourier transformed Radon space, before interpolation')
00067 xlabel('omega_x'),ylabel('omega_y')
00068 print -dpng 'Surface_of_Fourier_transformed_Radon_space_before_interpolation.png'
00069 
00070 figure
00071 surf(omega_x,omega_y,abs(Fourier_2D),...
00072                 'edgecolor','none')
00073 colormap(jet),colorbar
00074 title('Surface of Fourier transformed Radon space, after interpolation')
00075 xlabel('omega_x'),ylabel('omega_y')
00076 print -dpng 'Surface_of_Fourier_transformed_Radon_space_after_interpolation.png'
00077 end
00078
